publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-499 Donald Gorrie: Report on Holyrood Building—That the Parliament requests that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body prepare a report for consideration and debate by the Parliament detailing progress on the building at Holyrood, covering in particular the design, progress on site, cost so far, projected final costs and the overall timetable.

S1M-499 Donald Gorrie: Report on Holyrood Building—That the Parliament requests that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body prepare a report for consideration and debate by the Parliament detailing progress on the building at Holyrood, covering in particular the design, progress on site, cost so far, projected final costs and the overall timetable. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-499 Report on Holyrood Building (lodged on 3 February 2000) Mr John Swinney*
S1M-499 Report on Holyrood Building (lodged on 3 February 2000) Mr Murray Tosh*, Linda Fabiani*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-499 Report on Holyrood Building (lodged on 3 February 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Fergus Ewing*, Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*, Irene McGugan*

S1M-499 Donald Gorrie: Report on Holyrood Building-That the Parliament requests that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body prepare a report for consideration and debate by the Parliament detailing progress on the building at Holyrood, covering in particular the design, progress on site, cost so far, projected final costs and the overall timetable. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Mr John Swinney, Mr Murray Tosh, Linda Fabiani, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fergus Ewing, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-499 Report on Holyrood Building (lodged on 3 February 2000) Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-499 Report on Holyrood Building (lodged on 3 February 2000) Mr Keith Raffan*

S1M-499 Donald Gorrie: Report on Holyrood Building—That the Parliament requests that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body prepare a report for consideration and debate by the Parliament detailing progress on the building at Holyrood, covering in particular the design, progress on site, cost so far, projected final costs and the overall timetable. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Mr John Swinney, Mr Murray Tosh, Linda Fabiani, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fergus Ewing, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Keith Raffan

S1M-499 Report on Holyrood Building (lodged on 3 February 2000) Phil Gallie*, Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-499 Donald Gorrie: Report on Holyrood Building—That the Parliament requests that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body prepare a report for consideration and debate by the Parliament detailing progress on the building at Holyrood, covering in particular the design, progress on site, cost so far, projected final costs and the overall timetable. Supported by: Ms Margo MacDonald, Mr John Swinney, Mr Murray Tosh, Linda Fabiani, Mr Gil Paterson, Tricia Marwick, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Fergus Ewing, Alex Neil, Christine Grahame, Irene McGugan, Nora Radcliffe, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr David Davidson, Dennis Canavan, Phil Gallie, Dr Winnie Ewing
